name: places/ChIJGcxkpJRYwokR6YJRS3GavAM
formattedAddress: 20 E 74th St #1a, New York, NY 10021, USA
adrFormatAddress: 20 E 74th St #1a, New York, NY 10021-2654, USA

originalText.text: Good thoughtful doctor who has managed my mood disorder successfully for over a decade.  Yes he takes time to carefully review your chart in your presence and i have no objection to that, in fact quite the opposite im glad that he is.  He runs all the necessary tests regularly to insure kidney function is not impacted by the prescribed meds.  I dont find him condescending but he does lose patience if you speak over him rather than listen, so i listen and try not to interrupt.   Thats not too much to ask.  He takes his time and i never feel rushed.

originalText.text: Stay away! Where to start with this awful experience. I stopped seeing him over a year ago for several reasons (condescending beside manner, tardiness) but I come back now to write this review because now my current (and far superior doctor who is 1/3 the price) asked him for my previous medical records, and his office told me they have a "copy fee" for releasing medical records or 75 cents a page! I've never EVER heard of that and spoke with several other doctors who said the same. Another reason I stopped seeing him before- he spends the first 15 minutes of your appointment looking at notes from the previous session which should absolutely be taken care of ahead of time. Also, he only takes cash for an appointment, no credit card which I've never heard of for a doctor before or since either. My advice to anyone considering him is to stay away. There are better, less sketchy doctors out there would will be more consultative and compassionate as well.

originalText.text: I left my first appointment with Dr. Ludwig with more optimism and hope than I've had in a long time. He's not warm and fuzzy because that's not his job, he's a professional and he is a kind and very well qualified professional who takes the time to get to know you and offer real solutions.

text.text: I left my first appointment with Dr. Ludwig with more optimism and hope than I've had in a long time. He's not warm and fuzzy because that's not his job, he's a professional and he is a kind and very well qualified professional who takes the time to get to know you and offer real solutions.

originalText.text:
A truly excellent listener and investigative psychiatrist. Not someone who will rush to prescribe but will attempt to delve into the root of the problem.

In short, the kind of psychiatrist you want and need, but not the one whose advice is easily followed as it is not always easy to swallow.

In short, the kind of psychiatrist you want and need, but not the one whose advice is easily followed as it is not always easy to swallow.

originalText.text: I wasn't in crisis when I saw Dr Ludwig but I was after seeing him. He was authoritarian and dismissive of my concerns, and he made no effort to engage with me. He made me feel afraid and small.

text.text: I wasn't in crisis when I saw Dr Ludwig but I was after seeing him. He was authoritarian and dismissive of my concerns, and he made no effort to engage with me. He made me feel afraid and small.
